module.name: global
module.description: Global parameters for all trunk applications.

parameter.name: datacenterID
parameter.description: Sets the datacenter ID which is primarily used by Arclink and its tools. Should not contain spaces.

parameter.name: agencyID
parameter.description: Defines the agency ID used to set creationInfo.agencyID in data model objects. Should not contain spaces.

parameter.name: organization
parameter.description: Organization name used mainly by ArcLink and SeedLink.

parameter.name: author
parameter.description: Defines the author name used to set creationInfo.author in data model objects.

parameter.name: plugins
parameter.description: Defines a list of modules loaded at startup.

parameter.name: level
parameter.description: Sets the logging level between 1 and 4 where 1=ERROR, 2=WARNING, 3=INFO and 4=DEBUG.

parameter.name: file
parameter.description: Enables logging into a log file.

parameter.name: syslog
parameter.description: Enables logging to syslog if supported by the host system.

parameter.name: components
parameter.description: Limit the logging to the specified list of components, e.g. 'Application, Server'

parameter.name: component
parameter.description: For each log entry print the component right after the log level. By default the component output is enabled for file output but disabled for console output.

parameter.name: context
parameter.description: For each log entry print the source file name and line number.

parameter.name: timeSpan
parameter.description: Time span after which a log file is rotated.

parameter.name: archiveSize
parameter.description: How many historic log files to keep.

parameter.name: facility
parameter.description: Defines the syslog facility to be used according to the defined facility names in syslog.h. The default is local0. If the given name is invalid or not available, initializing logging will fail and the application quits.

parameter.name: server
parameter.description: Defines the Spread server name to connect to. Format is host[:port].

parameter.name: username
parameter.description: Defines the username to be used. The length is limited to 10 characters with Spread. By default the module name (name of the executable) is used but sometimes it exceeds the 10 character limit and access is denied. To prevent errors set a different username. An empty username will let Spread generate one.

parameter.name: timeout
parameter.description: The connection timeout in seconds. 3 seconds are normally more than enough. If a client needs to connect to a remote system with a slow connection a larger timeout might be needed.

parameter.name: primaryGroup
parameter.description: Defines the primary group of a module. This is the name of the group where a module sends its messages to if the target group is not explicitely given in the send call.

parameter.name: encoding
parameter.description: Defines the message encoding for sending. Allowed values are "binary" or "xml". XML has more overhead in processing but is more robust when schema versions between client and server are different.

parameter.name: subscriptions
parameter.description: Defines a list of message groups to subscribe to. The default is usually given by the application and does not need to be changed.

group.name: database
group.description: Defines the database connection. If no database is configured (which is the default) and a messaging connection is available the application will receive the parameters after the connection is established. Override these values only if you know what you are doing.

parameter.name: type
parameter.description: Defines the database backend to be used. The name corresponds to the defined name in the database plugin. Examples are: mysql, postgresql or sqlite3.

parameter.name: parameters
parameter.description: The database connection parameters. This value depends on the used database backend. E.g. sqlite3 expects the path to the database file whereas MYSQL or PostgreSQL expect an URI in the format user:pwd@host/database?param1=val1&param2=val2.

group.parameter: Load the inventory database from a given XML file if set. This overrides the inventory definitions loaded from the database backend.
Load the configuration database from a given XML file if set. This overrides the configuration definitions loaded from the database backend.

parameter.name: agencies
parameter.description: Defines a whitelist of agencies that are allowed for processing separated by comma.

parameter.name: agencies
parameter.description: Defines a blacklist of agencies that are not allowed for processing separated by comma.

parameter.name: target
parameter.description: A regular expression of all clients that should handle a command message usually send to the GUI messaging group. Currently this flag is only used by GUI applications to set an artificial origin and to tell other clients to show this origin. To let all connected clients handle the command, ".*$" can be used.

input.name: organization
input.description: This is used mainly by SeedLink and Arclink to identify the server organization. Also, the ArcLink full SEED volumes will have this organization value set.

binding.name: general
binding.description: Configures global parameters of a station for modules.

parameter.name: detecStream
parameter.description: Defines the channel code of the preferred stream used eg by scautopick and scrttv. If no component code is given, 'Z' will be used by default.

parameter.name: detecLocid
parameter.description: Defines the location code of the preferred stream used eg by scautopick and scrttv.

group.name: amplitudes
group.description: Defines general parameters for amplitudes of a certain type.

parameter.name: enable
parameter.description: Defines if amplitude calculation is enabled. If disabled then this station will be skipped for amplitudes and magnitudes.

parameter.name: saturationThreshold
parameter.description: Defines the saturation threshold for the optional saturation check. By default the saturation check is disabled but giving a value above 0 will enable it. Waveforms that are saturated are not used at all for amplitude calculations.

parameter.name: enableResponses
parameter.description: Activates deconvolution for this station. If no responses are configured an error is raised and the data is not processed.

struct.description: An amplitude profile configures global parameters for a particular amplitude type. The available amplitude types are not fixed and can be extended by plugins. The name of the type must match the one defined in the corresponding AmplitudeProcessor.

parameter.name: enable
parameter.description: Defines if amplitude calculation of certain type is enabled.

parameter.name: enableResponses
parameter.description: Activates deconvolution for this amplitude type. If not set the global flag "amplitudes.enableResponses" will be used instead.

parameter.name: saturationThreshold
parameter.description: If greater than 0 and the absolute value of an incoming unfiltered sample exceeds this value, the trace data is rejected and not used (saturation check).

parameter.name: minSNR
parameter.description: Defines the mininum SNR to be reached to compute the amplitudes. This value is amplitude type specific and has no global default value.

parameter.name: noiseBegin
parameter.description: Overrides the default time (relative to the trigger time) of the begin of the noise window used to compute the noise offset and noise amplitude. Each amplitude processor sets its own noise time window and this option should only be changed if you know what you are doing.

parameter.name: noiseEnd
parameter.description: Overrides the default time (relative to the trigger time) of the end of the noise window used to compute the noise offset and noise amplitude. Each amplitude processor sets its own noise time window and this option should only be changed if you know what you are doing.

parameter.name: signalBegin
parameter.description: Overrides the default time (relative to the trigger time) of the begin of the signal window used to compute the final amplitude. Each amplitude processor sets its own signal time window and this option should only be changed if you know what you are doing.

parameter.name: signalEnd
parameter.description: Overrides the default time (relative to the trigger time) of the end of the signal window used to compute the final amplitude. Each amplitude processor sets its own signal time window and this option should only be changed if you know what you are doing.

group.name: resp
group.description: Several parameters if usage of full responses is enabled.

parameter.name: minFreq
parameter.description: After data are converted in to the frequency domain that minimum frequency defines the end of the left-side cosine taper for the frequency spectrum. The taper applies from 0Hz to {minFreq}Hz. A value of 0 or lower disables that taper.

parameter.name: maxFreq
parameter.description: After data are converted in to the frequency domain that maximum frequency defines the start of the right-side cosine taper for the frequency spectrum. The taper applies from {maxFreq}Hz to {fNyquist}Hz. A value of 0 or lower disables that taper.

group.name: mag
group.description: Defines general parameters for magnitudes of a certain type.

struct.description: An magnitude profile configures global parameters for a particular magnitude type. The available magnitude types are not fixed and can be extended by plugins. The name of the type must match the one defined in the corresponding MagnitudeProcessor.

parameter.name: multiplier
parameter.description: Part of the magnitude station correction. The final magnitude value is multiplier*M+offset. This value is usually not required but there for completeness.

parameter.name: offset
parameter.description: Part of the magnitude station correction. The final magnitude value is multiplier*M+offset. This value can be used to correct station magnitudes.

group.name: BK
group.description: Bkpicker is an implementation of the Baer/Kradolfer picker adapted to SeisComP3. It was created by converting Manfred Baers from Fortran to C++ and inserting it as a replacement for the picker algorithm. The picker interface name to be used in configuration files is "BK".

parameter.name: signalBegin
parameter.description: Overrides the default time (relative to the trigger time) of the begin of the signal window used to pick.

parameter.name: signalEnd
parameter.description: Overrides the default time (relative to the trigger time) of the begin of the signal window used to pick.

parameter.name: filterType
parameter.description: BP (Bandpass) is currently the only option.

parameter.name: filterPoles
parameter.description: Number of poles.

parameter.name: f1
parameter.description: Bandpass lower cutoff freq. in Hz.

parameter.name: f2
parameter.description: Bandpass upper cutoff freq. in Hz.

parameter.name: thrshl1
parameter.description: Threshold to trigger for pick (c.f. paper), default 10

parameter.name: thrshl2
parameter.description: Threshold for updating sigma (c.f. paper), default 20

group.name: AIC
group.description: AIC picker is an implementation using the simple non-AR algorithm of Maeda (1985), see paper of Zhang et al. (2003) in BSSA. The picker interface name to be used in configuration files is "AIC".

parameter.name: signalBegin
parameter.description: Overrides the default time (relative to the trigger time) of the begin of the signal window used to pick.

parameter.name: signalEnd
parameter.description: Overrides the default time (relative to the trigger time) of the begin of the signal window used to pick.

parameter.name: filter
parameter.description: Overrides the default filter which is "raw". The typical filter grammar can be used.

parameter.name: minSNR
parameter.description: Defines the mininum SNR.

group.name: L2
group.description: L2 is a algorithm to pick S-phases.

parameter.name: noiseBegin
parameter.description: Overrides the relative data processing start time (relative to the triggering pick). This adds a margin to the actual processing and is useful to initialize the filter (e.g. STALTA). The data is not used at all until signalBegin is reached.

parameter.name: signalBegin
parameter.description: Overrides the relative start time (relative to the triggering pick) of the begin of the signal processing.

parameter.name: signalEnd
parameter.description: Overrides the relative end time (relative to the triggering pick) of the end of the signal window used to pick.

parameter.name: filter
parameter.description: Configures the filter used to compute the L2 and to pick the onset (with AIC) after the detector triggered.

parameter.name: detecFilter
parameter.description: Configures the detector in the filtered L2. This filter is applied on top of the base L2 filter.

parameter.name: threshold
parameter.description: The detector threshold that triggers the AIC picker.

parameter.name: timeCorr
parameter.description: The time correction (in seconds) added to the detection time before AIC time window is computed.

parameter.name: marginAIC
parameter.description: The AIC time window around the detection used to pick. If 0 AIC is not used.

parameter.name: minSNR
parameter.description: Defines the mininum SNR as returned from AIC.
